name: animatemodel
description: Programmatically animates a model's bone, without relying on animations

name: m
mid
model
modelid
attributes.description: The model to target

name: p
pid
part
partid
attributes.description: The bone to target and animate

name: em
exact
match
exactmatch
attributes.description: Whether the bone's name should exactly match the provided partid attribute. If set to false, every bone whose name contains partid's value will be targeted

name: r
rel
relative
attributes.description: Whether the provided values should be treated as relative to the current bone's position

name: o
ov
override
attributes.description: Whether the mechanic is used to override the bone's animation using animate mechanic or reverting to normal animation

name: copy
attributes.description: Whether to copy the bone's original transform

name: rm
rotmode
attributes.description: The rotation mode. Can be LOCAL or GLOBAL

name: bodyrotation
bodyclamp
description: Configure the body rotation of the modeled entity.

name: hu
head
headuneven
attributes.description:
Is the head clamp uneven.
Head clamp is used to clamp the head when an entity is moving.

name: mh
mxh
maxhead
attributes.description:
Maximum head angle in degrees.
If `headuneven` is false, the minimum head angle would be set as the negative of this value.

name: mnh
minhead
attributes.description:
Minimum head angle in degrees.
Only takes effect when `headuneven` is true.

name: bu
body
bodyuneven
attributes.description:
Is the body clamp uneven.
Body clamp is used to clamp the body when an entity is standing still.

name: mb
mxb
maxbody
attributes.description:
Maximum body angle in degrees.
If `bodyuneven` is false, the minimum body angle would be set as the negative of this value.

name: mnb
minbody
attributes.description:
Minimum body angle in degrees.
Only takes effect when `bodyuneven` is true.

name: m
mode
player
playermode
attributes.description: Should the body rotate like a player (i.e. will not try to match the head angle)

name: s
stable
attributes.description: Stable angle in degrees where the body rotation can exceed the clamp before snapping towards the clamped values

name: rde
rdelay
attributes.description: Rotation delay in ticks before the body rotate towards the head

name: rdu
rduration
attributes.description: Rotation duration in ticks the body takes to rotate towards the head

Change the model of a rendering bone to use a different model.

name: init
initrender
attributes.description: Whether the model should immediately be shown to players. If false, this allows you to further customize your model before showing with [RenderInit](https://git.lumine.io/mythiccraft/model-engine-4/-/wikis/Skills/Mechanics/RenderInit)

name: showhitbox
attributes.description:
Should the model's hitbox be visible.
If hidden, the player can no longer interact with the model.

name: showshadow
attributes.description: Should the shadow be visible

name: syncbody
attributes.description: Should the body rotation be synced to the head rotation

name: modelplayerskin
modelskin

name: m
mid
model
modelid
attributes.description: Targeted model. If null, targets all models.

name: p
pbone
limbs
attributes.description: Targeted player limb bones (e.g. bone1,bone2,bone3). If null, targets all player limb bones.

name: uuid
attributes.description:
Use the texture of the player with this UUID.
UUID works with or without dashes (`-`)
Player does not need to be online. Texture data is only downloaded once.

name: user
name
username
attributes.description:
Use the texture of a player.
Player does not need to be online. Texture data is only downloaded once.

name: s
skin
attributes.description: Base64 texture data. If the data does not contain model information, default to CLASSIC model.

name: slim
attributes.description: Force the player model. If not set, it will default to the model the texture is using.

name: modifystate
modifyanimation
modstate

Modify an animation played by the targeted active model.  
This mechanic can change the lerp in time, lerp out time, speed, loop mode and override mode of an animation.

mid
model
modelid

name: s
state

name: p

Priority of the animation
This is only read when model is using the new animation system

name: li
lerpin

name: lo
lerpout

name: l
loop

name: ov

name: mountmodel
description: Mount an entity to a model's driver seat, or a specific mount bone.

name: d
drive
driver
attributes.description: Is mounting a driver

name: f
force
attributes.description:
Is trying to forcibly mount an entity.
If true and driver=true, it will dismount the old driver.
If true and driver=false, it will mount the target on the least occupied mount bone.
Otherwise, it will not mount the target if the seat is already occupied.

name: ad
autodismount
attributes.description: Should the target dismount from the old mount if they are mounted already

name: dmg
damagemount
attributes.description: Can the target damage the mount

name: int
interactmount
attributes.description: Can the target interact with the mount (right click)

name: m
mode
attributes.description: The controller mode specific to the target. Also works when driver=false for Meta Controllers

name: mid
model
modelid
attributes.description:
Targeted model.
If driver = true, it is used to mount on the driver seat of a model that does not represent main mount controller.
Otherwise, used to mount on passenger seats.

name: p
pbone
seat
attributes.description: Targeted mount bones (e.g. bone1,bone2,bone3).

name: move
description:
Directly controls the entity to move at a certain direction.
This mechanic accounts for step height, meaning the entity would move up blocks based on its step height.

name: side
x
attributes.description: Left/right movement of the entity

name: up
y
attributes.description: Up/down movement of the entity

name: front
z
attributes.description: Front/back movement of the entity

name: speed
attributes.description: Speed modifier of the mount

name: global
g
attributes.description: Whether the direction is using global axis

name: queue
q
attributes.description:
Queue the movement
Mainly used for calling this method outside of [Meta Controller](https://git.lumine.io/mythiccraft/model-engine-4/-/wikis/Technical/Mount-Controllers#meta-controllers)

name: nofall
cancelfall
cancelfalldamage
description:
Cancel the fall of the entity.
Under the hood, this is resetting the entity's internal drop distance counter to 0, causing it to assume that it just started falling. If called too early, fall damage might still not be negated.

name: pairmodel

name: remapmodel
remap
description:
Remap a new model to the current model, part by part.
This is useful for doing "phase change" of a model if both model shares the same structure. Where instead removing the model and adding a new one, this method would just replace the bone models of the current model.
If a part is not found, it will remain unchanged.

name: m
mid
model
modelid
attributes.description: Targeted model

name: n
nid
newmodel
newmodelid
attributes.description: The model being used to remap the targeted model

name: map
attributes.description:
The model used to map newmodel to model.
If this is set, all bones (including ghost bones) will be used to map the model.
Otherwise, newmodel would be used and only renderer bones are used.

renderinit

name: submodel
description:
Forcibly create or delete bones from a model.
This is mainly used for removing interactive bones such as sub-hitboxes or seats.
If you want to hide a renderer bone temporarily, use [PartVisibility](https://git.lumine.io/mythiccraft/model-engine-4/-/wikis/Skills/Mechanics/PartVisibility) instead.

name: m
mid
model
modelid
attributes.description: Targeted model

name: p
pid
part
partid
attributes.description: The parent of the added bone

name: sp
spid
subpart
subpartid
attributes.description: The added bone. All child bone of this bone will also be added.

name: pfx
prefix
attributes.description:
Prefix of the newly added bones.
This is used to distinguish duplicate bones.
E.g.`sp=test;pfx=custom_` will add a bone called `custom_test`.
This new bone name can be targeted by other mechanics.

name: r
remove
attributes.description: Is this mechanic used for removing bones

name: swapentity
description:
Swap the owner of an active model from one entity to the targeted entity.
Yet another mechanic with little use case, but it is possible anyway.

name: m
mid
model

name: s
step
attributes.description: The step height of the model

name: rad
radius
attributes.description:
Visible radius of the model.
Values less than or equal to 0 will not be read

name: syncyaw
description:
Sync the yaw of the entity to either the head or body yaw.
Minecraft tracks 3 types of yaw internally: `yaw`, `head_yaw` and `body_yaw`. It is not guaranteed that `yaw` is the equal to the other yaws, but local entity movements use `yaw`. Hence, this mechanic exists to guarantee the yaw is synced to either the head or body.

name: target
t
to
attributes.description:
Yaw to be modified
Can only be `yaw`, `body`, `head` or `all`

name: body
b
src
from
attributes.description:
Whether the yaw is syncing to the body yaw
Can be `yaw`, `body` or `false`
If false, uses head yaw instead

name: en
enchant
attributes.description: Whether the vfx should be enchanted

name: v
visible
attributes.description: Is the VFX visible by default

name: bv
bvisible
attributes.description:
Is the base entity visible by default.
Has no effect when the target is a projectile.

name: vfxposreset
description: Reset the VFX position back to 0 0 0.

name: vfxrotreset
description: Reset the VFX rotation back to 0 0 0.

name: vfxscalereset
vfxsclreset
vfxscareset
description: Reset the VFX scale back to 1 1 1.

name: vfxpos
description: Position the VFX. The position is local to the VFX, and does not affect the actual VFX entity's location.

name: p
pos
position
attributes.description: Position of the VFX, in the `x,y,z` format

name: x
attributes.description: X component of the position. Only read when `position` is null

name: y
attributes.description: Y component of the position. Only read when `position` is null

name: z
attributes.description: Z component of the position. Only read when `position` is null

name: r
rel
relative
attributes.description: Is the position change relative, meaning should it add onto the current position

name: vfxrot
description: Rotation the VFX. The rotation is local to the VFX, and does not affect the actual VFX entity's rotation.

name: r
rot
rotation
attributes.description: Rotation of the VFX, in the `x,y,z` format and in degrees

name: x
attributes.description: X component of the rotation in degrees. Only read when `rotation` is null

name: y
attributes.description: Y component of the rotation in degrees. Only read when `rotation` is null

name: z
attributes.description: Z component of the rotation in degrees. Only read when `rotation` is null

name: rel
relative
attributes.description: Is the rotation change relative, meaning should it add onto the current rotation

name: neworigin
origin
o
attributes.description: Should the rotation be applied using the world axis

name: vfxscale
vfxscl
vfxsca
description: Scale the VFX.

name: s
sca
scl
scale
attributes.description: Scale of the VFX, in the `x,y,z` format

name: x
attributes.description: X component of the scale. Only read when `scale` is null

name: y
attributes.description: Y component of the scale. Only read when `scale` is null

name: z
attributes.description: Z component of the scale. Only read when `scale` is null

name: r
rel
relative
attributes.description: Is the scale change relative, meaning should it add onto the current scale

name: vfxsetvis
description: Set the visibility of the VFX.

name: v
visible
attributes.description: Is visible

name: vfxtint
vfxcolor
description: Color the VFX, or animate from one color to another.

name: duration
d
attributes.description: Duration of the color change

name: c
color
ca
colora
attributes.description: The color in hex

name: cb
colorb
attributes.description: Target color in hex. Only read when `duration` greater than 0
